website_summaries.verdict: A good pick for value-seekers who don't plan to ride their bikes in extreme darkness and prefer battery-powered lights to rechargeable models.
pros: A headlight/taillight set that produces LED light – headlight is visible up to 1,500 ft. and light up to 40 ft. range
Weather-resistant, easy to install, and budget-priced
cons: Requires 6 AAA batteries, but you get up to 100 hours life
Doesn't light up as well as competitors in total darkness

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE/ DOES NOT CONNECT STURDY TO BIKE. BEWARE!!! DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS PAIR OF LIGHTS!!!!! PLASTIC PACKAGING was CUT and open already and the connector for the back light does not stay sturdy. The front light latch doesn't stay on the mount. basically just have two lights and can't connect them to the bike at all. waste of money. I purchased other lights from other sellers. I will be asking for a refund. This is probably the worst item i received in amazon and am very disappointed. i did not expect the quality to change so much from my previous lights i purchased from another seller a while ago and those lights still work but I gave them away with my old bike.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Broke down in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.text: It was working OK for the first couple of months but then not sure why, the intensity of the light decreased. I decided to change batteries to see if that may help but it broke down when I was changing the battery. One of the polarization pins over the lamp board came off. I will try to resolder the pin to its position but it is very disappointing that board is very poorly made and broke down as soon as I try to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: kkose

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: At this price this is a very functional set. Your not going to spotlight a jackrabbit at 100 yards but I used it no problem in a moonless pitchblack bike path nightly. The batteries last about 6 weeks of 1.5 to 2 hours of weeknight use. I used alkaline. The tail roughly 2 months of the same. No problems mounting. The strobe seems to simulate a cop light as i noticed people would slow down when seeing it vice the straight blinking light. Bonus for that. Just keep a hand or finger in front of the light when dismounting it cause it will shoot out of the mounting bracket.
customer_reviews.author: TamBoorg

customer_reviews.title: You know when they say you get what you pay for?
customer_reviews.text: You know when they say you get what you pay for? That holds true for this product. This product is cheap, and unfortunately that's what you will get out of this product. If a product is cheap but of great quality, it's great for consumers. This is the opposite however, it's cheap and horrible quality. It's really flimsy, difficult to attach properly, the instructions are poor, the material is of very low quality, and it doesn't even ship with batteries for the lights because the company wanted to save those extra few cents. You would be better off investing a few extra dollars on something of better quality. I highly regret making this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: the lights worked perfect for 10 months
customer_reviews.text: the lights worked perfect for 10 months. then the front light would not turn off. . i changed the batteries thinking that would help. now the front light will not turn on at all. great light and i have purchased two of them over the past year. but disappointed that one quit working in 10 months. (Bike is stored in a shed and out of the weather all the time. Light is used occasionally). would like to hear from manufacturer about possible trouble shooting. 10/13/2018 i later contacted the company and they replaced the light free! light working perfectly now.!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Miller

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connection to the handlebars.
customer_reviews.text: Light is OK at best. But the biggest issue is the connection to the handlebar, it has a huge design flaw. The connector has a swivel point that is extremely weak. Mine broke off on almost the first bump and light fell off, resulting in light shuttering and being totally destroyed. At first I thought my issue was a sliding connector, but it was connected all the way in and even clicked in, but undes closes scrutiny I noticed that it is swivel point that broke. Spend money on something sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya P

customer_reviews.title: Lights will fly out of mounts
customer_reviews.text: Lost both lights within 24 hours of mounting. Not meant for rough road riding. Everything was mounted tight, but hitting a few potholes at speed just made the lights fly right out of the rails/mounts. Definitely a cheap mounting system. The actual lights were decent for the price though, but now useless to me. Granted, my bike doesnt have any suspension and the roads that i ride can be choppy at times. This setup might work for gentle riding on paved bike paths, but not riding hard. Couldnt retrieve either of the lights either because I lost them at intersections at night and they didnt seem worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: eliknos

customer_reviews.title: Work great even after five years
customer_reviews.text: I am quite surprised that it's been five years that I bought this head/tail lamp pair, and they still work great. The headlamp does it's job of being seen. Doesn't really provide light enough to see the road ahead though. I couldn't believe that I replaced the original batteries from the tail lamp (after five years). The nut on the tail has rusted which is kinda expected wear and tear. However, electricals inside are still good. Replacing the tail lamp battery was bit tricky, which is why I came to this page and eventually wrote this review. I would recommend these to anyone who is looking for bike head/tail lamps in order to 'be seen'.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Not as bright as I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Overall good product, easy to install and detach when leaving the bike somewhere. I would have given it 5 stars but the headlight, compared to other LED lights that I own, is just not very bright. If you ride in dark areas, without street lights, and count on the headlight to light up your path well, I would look for a brighter light.
customer_reviews.author: CRazz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Rode around at night with this set for two days. On the second night, the front headlight just quit working and decided it was done. It was cheap. I should have expected it to be cheaply made. I bought another set on Amazon for a little bit more and the craftsmanship difference is incredible. It's worth the price to pay a little more and have an headlight that has more movement, 3 brightness settings, is waterproof and fastens on and off the clip easily. My advice if you are looking at this item, Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: That Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great lights but it comes with two mounting systems. The hard plastic one will break very soon but the new wrap around rubber one is perfect. Both are for the headlight. The back red light is great the way it is. Overall a sturdier redesign of the headlight mounting system would result in less breakage and better quality. However, it’s super bright and the kids use them all the time. I just had to zip tie the broken ones to their bikes. We own 5 of these and 3 are broken. The adults’ lights are not broken.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful
customer_reviews.text: This won't be the brightest headlight you'll ever find. If you ride a night at lot, I might suggest finding something more powerful. But for those occasional trips home after getting caught out after dark, it is great. The headlight's best feature are the two different strobe modes. These are more for alerting others to the bike's presence than illuminating the road ahead. But between those two things, we'll take not getting run down over not being able to see 100 yards ahead. The rear lights are especially bright, and also with multiple blinking modes to get the attention of cars behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Seasons Vacations

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it's great
customer_reviews.text: Biking without a front and back light is only OK if you just ride in the summer when it is full sunlight. If you're a more regular bike rider and want to be visible, buy these lights. When they work, they're great. I've had two sets. The headlight in the first set conked out one day - the switch would go through its cycle until I came to "off" - and then, it skipped "off", so the only way to turn out the light was to remove the batteries. I bought a second set - they are less than $10 including shipping. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: For afternoon riding
customer_reviews.text: Background: Female road cyclist, average 70-100 miles per week. I bought a bike at Walmart to leave at my mother's house. Sunset is a it earlier in PR and it is often darker out by 6:30. So, I bought 2 sets of these for emergencies. I keep fresh batteries on these and use both of them. One light is not enough. I do not use it for night riding at all. One definitely needs a stronger light than these. It is good for afternoon riding. The mounts attach with some ease but they are not durable. It is a cheap light set for emergencies. Nothing that will be lasting years.
customer_reviews.author: Morrigan Alexandros

customer_reviews.title: Faulty & terrible return policy. First was great, the next two arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for myself last year and liked it enough to buy a second for my friend. It arrived broken, so I requested a replacement and it too arrived broken. Wouldn't blame the seller as there was no way to tell from the packaging, but the manufacturer clearly needs to up its QC game. The AMAZON return policy is infuriating because I need to drop the first one off at Kohl's and take the second to UPS. Not at all pleased, Amazon. Definitely not going to renew Prime any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Cielo Perso

customer_reviews.title: Bright front light makes a good flashlight, too.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set to replace the front light that was stolen off my bike. Who steals a cracked bike light that's duct-taped to the handlebar? Well, somebody, that's who. Anyway, this is a very nice replacement that I can click on and off its holder when I lock the bike up. Three settings on the front light--steady, flashing, and seizure-inducing--I normally use the flash setting on evening rides home. I haven't attached the rear light yet because I still have my old one and it hasn't been stolen, but it works fine and now I have it as a backup for that inevitable day when somebody comes back and helps themselves to my rear light.
customer_reviews.author: Sammygirl

customer_reviews.title: DIFFCULT TO ASSEMBLE HEADLIGHT AND WHEN DID, DIDN'T WORK-RETURNED
customer_reviews.text: Lousy instructions..only drawings, with nothing on how to remove battery holder in headlight. HARD to removed without damaging case. Finally was able to. Removed battery holder since when put in batteries, couldn't get headlight to align with contacts inside. Ridiculous and cheap. Returning, and will go to reputable bike shop to find something that works better and easier to use. Only gets 2 stars due to tailight was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: addictedtoreading

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to install and do an adequate job
customer_reviews.text: The lights seem OK. They were easy to install and do an adequate job. The price was right. I like that the tail light has a couple flashing options- makes it more noticeable to approaching cars and saves on batteries. As for the headlight I'm not impressed with the brightness considering it takes 4 batteries. Also, the beam pattern is too narrow. I wouldn't depend on it to light up a rough road in the dark. I have good street lighting in my subdivision so I just set it to strobe mode for maximum visibility to traffic.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Dave

customer_reviews.title: Fell off first ride.
customer_reviews.text: So i installed this on my scooter, was good to go. Was clipped in and everything, im riding to work with it and it literally just fell off the mount. I dont know how something that clicks in like that can just fall off, but this is poor quality. I just went over a sidewalk, not really any bumpy roads or anything and it fell off. i didnt realize it till later, and i would of been late to work if i went looking for it. Spend more money and get a better quality light!
customer_reviews.author: Hamza Hashem

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: This item was very easy to mount and has a nice bright lights and different modes for flashing. However the front light will not stay mounted. It keeps coming off and will not stay in place. Over the weekend it came off several times and was very aggravating to my son and me for that matter. It is not the piece that is supposed to come off with the clip but the piece that is supposed to stay attached that keeps coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to setup but works great
customer_reviews.text: Really good considering it's less than 10 bucks. Everything works. The front light is a bit tricky to setup at first, after you put in the batteries, you need to pay attention to which direction to insert it back to the case, make sure the button side lines up, it's also very hard to push the battery case inside the outer case if you have it in the wrong direction, and the button won't work if you put it the wrong direction. Other than the above issue, everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: This item is cheap and easily breakable.  The bike professional had issues with the item.
customer_reviews.text: I paid for the item to be placed on my bike by a professional who assembles bikes at Dicks Sporting Goods Store The bike associated had a difficult time pulling apart the doors of the light to find the battery case. The item ended up breaking, it was so fragile and easily breakable. The Bike Associate replaced the broken light with a new Dicks bike light and light reflector kit that has an usb cord so I won't have to use batteries. The situation turned out better than it started out. I would not recommend buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very short lifetime.  Like 65 days.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second of these I have bought. The first lasted almost a year. The second one, purchased late August has quit working by the end of September. The battery pack tests ok for voltage but nothing gets past the little microswitch. So...this makes the headlight useless. It served its purpose when working but with the days much shorter I really need the headlight to work so I can be seen.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: I feel so much safer!
customer_reviews.text: This light set has exceeded my expectations thus far! I’m an avid biker, but have been restricted to daylight hours before getting these. I love the ease of transitioning into the evening hours safely. The options of different lighting are a bonus as I’ve noticed that vehicles tend to notice me more quickly when utilizing the flashing option. Even today, I left work and the haze from the fires made for more difficult than usual sighting. I felt comfortable riding with my stagnant lights on my bike to ensure that others couldn’t miss me. I would definitely recommend these, especially at the price point offered!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: The absolute best bicycle light
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best bicycle light! If you have not purchased any of these, and I assume if you're reading this, you have not - there is no way you/your children will not be seen in the dark. The light is very good, has three settings to flash, etc and thectail lights the same! They are easy to attach - well, I did it. I am a mature woman (ok, kinda old), and usually only do the "girl things". But I did all the assembly on three scooters and one bicycle. I will purchase these again. I secretly kept one for inside house for flashlight. Yeah.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Pulliam

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Attach, Solid Performance
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. They attach firmly and securely to the bike, but I can also easily detach just the lights if, for example, I park the bike someplace and worry the lights might get nicked. Three different settings for the lights, from solid to alternating/flickering. The lights are pretty bright, especially the white LED. I even used it the other evening for coming back on a dark trail as the sun was going down. The beam was large and bright enough for me to see a few feet out in front of me, which was nice. Not bad for just a handful of batteries. Hopefully the lights will continue to work for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JJG70

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good: Consistent and up to the task of heavy day-to-day use
customer_reviews.text: Both lights came and function as advertised. I've had great battery life out of both so far. I use both lights for about one to one and a half hours per day while biking to and from work. The front LED is clearly visible during broad daylight and the red tail light isn't too far behind that. I use them both at all times while biking on the full blink setting to increase my visibility as much as possible. Will purchase again if my current set breaks for any reason. So far, so great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Nice and bright. Different settings. Could even use the front light as a flash light, as it is easily detachable. (Hopefully nobody steals it, but I could just order another if they do.
customer_reviews.author: djchabot

customer_reviews.title: The light set is ok - 2 star.
customer_reviews.text: The lights were ok at first. Within a couple days the push button switch on the back light stopped working. Then, the bike tipped over and the front light snapped off at the swivel area which makes me think the plastic is cheap. Durability 1 star. Also, the beam on the front light is a round circle and also little circles pointing up down and sideways which I didn’t understand why. So the beam I give it a 2 star. The back light when it worked was nice and bright. The positive are the rubber clamps which were super easy to attach to the bike, 5 star clamps. Overall I’d give this light set a 2.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Culverhouse

customer_reviews.title: Bright lights with different modes, and secure fasteners
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my son's bike because sometimes he needs to ride home from a friend’s house in dusk or dark. The headlight is super bright, so not only does it light his pathway, but makes him super visible to cars. I love that both the white headlight and the red taillight can be on constantly, flashing consistently, or flashing an SOS pattern. The multiple fasteners worked great on my son's bike, tightening securely to avoid any jiggling of the lights. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly both front and back are my favorite bike lights
customer_reviews.text: Both the front and back lights are surprisingly my favorite bike lights. The front's mount the fastest to take off and put on a bike. I just leave the back one on at all times, and if someone steals it (people do), it's so cheap and I have a backup light on my helmet. For both lights, the buttons turn on when I want them to and don't when I don't.
customer_reviews.author: GayIsGreat

customer_reviews.title: Great lights and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great lights, I did have an issue with the tail light, so I contacted Bikepark USA. They corrected my issue in the first response. I have this at 4 stars for now and I hope to adjust to 5 stars after I get a week of use under my belt. 9-25 I moved this to 5 stars, I had an issue with the tail light and I am honestly not sure if it was a product or operator error. Either way, I contacted BikeUSA and they replaced the tail light and it is working great now.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great light for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased, so I cannot speak to the durability - but this lights are a great value. I like the fact that they run on AAA batteries and NOT rechargeable. I don't ride in the evening regularly, so I really don't want to have to worry about their charge during a ride. Quite bright and the extra mounting methods made it handy to mount (the headlamp onto my aerobars)
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: BREAKS EASILY!  DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a foot push scooter and I am not rough with my scooter. Less than two months after purchasing this, it broke--when I paused to unlock my front door. I wasn't being rough with it any way. I cried because I am too poor to replace it. These things made in China all seem to be of increasingly poor quality. Now I can't be street legal if I have to ride my scooter at night. And I'm friends with a police Captain in my city!
customer_reviews.author: Cali Carol

customer_reviews.title: The rear red blinking light failed after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually very happy with products from Amazon especially if it is labelled "Amazon's Choice". In this case the rear red blinking lamp failed after 2 months. I had only turned it on 3 times because I usually bike in daylight. I first thought it was the batteries but even with new batteries it won't turn on. Obviously it failed after the return period had expired. The front light works fine and I'm happy with it. I don't know if there is any way I can just get a replacement because it obviously is still within the warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: jon503

customer_reviews.title: Lights are Very Bright easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I Purchased these for my child's bike for when they are riding to and from their night time job. Easy to install less than 2 minutes. Battery life is excellent have had this for a few months now and with daily use lights are still very bright and have yet to change the batteries. I was surprised at how bright the lights are and how far they reach if you are using these for night time commutes there is a problem if someone doesn't see you. 3 light modes makes you extremely visible at night.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but they work.
customer_reviews.text: Not a high quality or anything but they work well enough. I got them for my 9yo son. He takes his bike to school and back so I got a set of lights that are cheap enough that it won't bother me too much if they are lost or stolen. At first I thought the headlight didn't work but you really have to put the batteries in just perfect and twist the top back on carefully yet forcefully.
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: Snapped swivel mount
customer_reviews.text: I liked this set up a lot. Easy install, great light. I parked bike in the city yesterday and went to remove the light from the mount. I pushed the little tab piece and the plastic snapped from the mount. There are no replacement parts for the cheap plastic so I'll have to buy another kit. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: I like the fact that after the light is mounted
customer_reviews.text: VERY bright LEDs! Headlight has three settings, straight beam, flashing, and rapid flashing. I like the fact that after the light is mounted, it can be rotated and stays in place. This means I can mount it off center, since I have a pouch on my front handle bars, and can rotate it so it shines in front of my bike, Love this pair and excited to see how well it continues to perform.
customer_reviews.author: The Romans

customer_reviews.title: Front light mount break easily
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sets. Within a week, my son broke the front light mount on both. The mount is made of rigid plastic and doesn't take much force to break. I am happy with the lights - both front and back. Just wish the mount is more durable. Now I have two perfectly working front lights but without mounts. I wonder if the company sells mounts separately.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Works good on kids bikes
customer_reviews.text: I use these on the kids bikes - they mount easily and the kids figured out how to turn on and off. I did not show them how to remove the light from the mount by pressing on the tab so they are less likely to get lost. Both light provide good visibility and front light provides a medium amount of light to see the road ahead.
customer_reviews.author: G Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good overall
customer_reviews.text: They work well but the front headlight pieces can be difficult to align when reassembling after changing the batteries. Someone stole my first set and I broke the headlight in my second while trying to un-jam it after inserting the battery holder wrong. Also, if you remove the lights while the bike is locked outside to prevent theft, the taillight turns on very easily if bumped in your bag.
customer_reviews.author: AEJ

customer_reviews.title: and they work great so far
customer_reviews.text: I just installed these lights, and they work great so far. I use them on my bike so that cars can see me rather than so I can see. They description didn't mention this, but you need 6 AAA batteries to power both of these, and they do not come with batteries, which I think would have been helpful information. Installing them on my bike wash a little more of a pain than I expected, but hopefully that means they will stay on well.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: I tried putting aluminum foil on the contacts like someone else mentioned in reviews but the problem in ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't use this light for a long time after I bought it. When I finally decided to put it on a new bike it wouldn't work. There seems to be a problem with the switch. I tried putting aluminum foil on the contacts like someone else mentioned in reviews but the problem in my unit seems to lie in the switch.
customer_reviews.author: bighitter

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly does the job. Bright forward and rear facing lights. Headlight has 3 options flashing, steady and the pulse function all useful depending on what time of day you're riding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: at a great price. Only downside is that between the two ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty bright for biking at night, at a great price. Only downside is that between the two of them they take 6 AAA batteries... Which just about doubles the purchasing price of this set. Otherwise very functional, easy to attach, and have a rubber coating on the inside so they don't scratch up your bike. Overall would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon989898

customer_reviews.title: Lights are very bright.
customer_reviews.text: Once I was able to get the sealed packaging apart the rest was easy. Takes 4 AAA batts for the black flashlight and 2 for the red tail light. tail light has 3 or 4 modes switched by small push button on the rear side. Both slide in and out of the holder attached to the bike. You can wear the red one on your pants too. The black one also has several modes. Lights are very bright.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cousins

customer_reviews.title: Ok.
customer_reviews.text: The head light comes with various rubber inserts to help the mount fit on to the handlebars. The taillight mount I was unable to mount to the seat stem as it is to small. Thought of mounting it on the supports on the rear but it was to big or would be placed at an angle that was useless. I would recommend going to a brick and mortar bike shop and getting the correct size of safety lights.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Rehmel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Plastic
customer_reviews.text: This was my other attempt at buying a decent light kit for my bikes. The kit was inexpensive, but shows the cheapness. The mounting system was easy, but the rest of the components, the lights, were all very cheap plastic. I would not recommend it. Once we had it mounted, it kept falling off the clip every little bump.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Great Brightness, Battery Life limited
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for about a year. It was easy to mount and was very bright, but the battery life on the rechargeable front part was pretty limited--the front light would start flashing low battery after about 15 minutes, and I always set it to flashing. It never died on me, though, and 20 minutes was probably my longest nightime ride.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Bright idea
customer_reviews.text: these lights are a super value. I haven't used the red tail light yet, but the front facing white light is bright, Mount easily, and is very durable. I particularly liked that the kit came with several pieces of hardware that let you mount the light on different diameters of tubes are handlebars or even straps for awkward shaped orientations.
customer_reviews.author: J.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set for the flashlight alone, thinking the back blinker was basically just a bonus. So, the fact that the back blinker doesn't fit on my seat bar (or any other logical spot to put it) doesn't really affect my rating. The flashlight itself is plenty powerful and gives quite a wide cone of light for me when I'm riding at night. I can only assume that they have updated their technology since some of these older reviews indicate the opposite. The light was easy to fasten to my handlebars and stays on them sturdily. AAA batteries not included. Will update if something happens, as I've only had the light on my bike for just over a week.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I got three of those lights, mostly because they use AAA battery so easy to replace. The light is bright enough in the dark, definitely for safety purpose. For lighting up path forward, it’s adequate but it would be even better if a bit brighter. Build is a bit flimsy, doesn’t look like it can stand up to abuse. Given the price, I won’t complain.
customer_reviews.author: X. Xu

customer_reviews.title: great light
customer_reviews.text: This was for my sister. She's been using it a few months now. She says it works fine. Her bike is a little funky so she wasn't able to attach the back light. That being said, she said that this is the only light she found that the back light can be attached to her backpack instead, with any other light she wouldn't have been able to attach it at all (according to her, I know nothing about bikes), so I consider that a plus. She's happy with it, so I'm happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Head lights are a disaster.
customer_reviews.text: The back light worked alright on the first set that I ordered but not the front light. I took brand new batteries and even turned them around even thought I thought this is crazy as the plus side was on the opposite but I was not able to get it working. Than I was so kindly sent a second one and the same thing again with the front light. I will give it one more try and have a very handy person have a look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne J Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Good for the
customer_reviews.text: These definitely are not the brightest lights on the road, nor are they sophisticated. I bought them for my pre-teen daughter's bike just to make her a bit easier to see when riding. They mounted easily and are a good deal for the price. Great for a kid's bike, or for a casual user in areas that aren't too busy.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Rummel

customer_reviews.title: Quality matches the low price
customer_reviews.text: Been using it but it is what you pay for. It comes in a cheap plastic packaging without batteries. I installed the front light to my bike and the quick release is pretty hard for me to use so I have just been leaving it on my bike even when I leave it locked and unattended because it's such a hassle to take it off. The red blinky light unfortunately fell on the ground and the plastic casing broke immediately and was rendered useless. It is decent for the price you pay when it is on lightning deal though. Battery for the front light has lasted a while though I don't really bike that often and usually for shorter rides.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Being able to be seen
customer_reviews.text: I had it for a week Hey I'm not went inside the store and somebody feed that they needed it more than I did I forgot to remove it from my bike and somebody wanted a 5 finger discount But before that happened it worked great i had my wife follow me she said she could see from a good distance
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Works well but the headlight is not bright
customer_reviews.text: The white light works but it is not super bright like advertised . Comparing to other lights I’ve seen yesterday at night bike ride it’s much less powerful. I must say that it was lower in price so it turned to be lower in quality. I would buy a different item if I would have known the quality of the light would not be to my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Yuri Gorodetsky

customer_reviews.title: The two front lights are not real bright but using two of them works great. However I am still out a tail light ...
customer_reviews.text: I think that they may have a quality control problem with their red taillight assembly line. I have purchased two units. The first tail light wouldn't turn on (I tossed it) and the second one wouldn't turn off. The two front lights are not real bright but using two of them works great. However I am still out a tail light and the cost of returning it is incentive for me to look else-ware.
customer_reviews.author: Cardy

customer_reviews.title: Rear light is undependable.
customer_reviews.text: I only use my bike occasionally. On the approximate 4 occasions, I have used it since I purchased the BV Bicycle Light Set, the rear light has only worked once. It goes on and off randomly for no apparent reason. I am handy so it's nothing obvious like the batteries. Good luck to others. I'll let you know if the manufacturer is decent enough to replace, given that I have only had the set two months.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B.

customer_reviews.title: Great! Installation was easy and they work as intended ...
customer_reviews.text: Great! Installation was easy and they work as intended - one thing to note is the rubber spacers included on the mounting brackets. I was a little confused at first why it wasn't sitting properly but then I realized you could remove some of the rubber strips, and after some trial and error and it turned out just fine. The different flashing modes are helpful as well for increased visibility.
customer_reviews.author: John Schwarzkopf

customer_reviews.title: Great "to be seen" lights
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Small footprint. Nice and compact. Look good. Three modes for the headlight and the tail light are very nice. Love the strobe feature. These are great lights when the intention is "to be seen". You'd need more lumens to use these as commuting lights in the dark. Overall, excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Dad

customer_reviews.title: Have a Backup Light With You
customer_reviews.text: No issues the first couple of weeks then I noticed that whenever I was on a bumpy road or anything that would cause the bike to shake the front light would shut off and then come back on. Sometimes it required me to press the power button to get it to turn back on. So I replaced the batteries hoping that was the problem however the front light continued flickering to the point now it will not even turn on. The tail light works great, I guess, I'm assuming it doesn't flicker. Fortunately I carry a mini flashlight in my pouch for those early morning rides, been using it ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Justice

customer_reviews.title: Good light... but...
customer_reviews.text: The flashlight itself is great, however, when riding the bike for the first time - the bracket that holds the light broke when I hit a small bump in the road. I see that the mounting base on the flashlight where you would install it on the bracket is kinda small. So, I give this item 3 stars due to the unsturdiness of the mount on the light. The light itself is bright.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: Moment I opened up the package I knew it was cheap plastic. Everything is plastic and you can tell it will break after one drop. I tried to put in the batteries in the main flashlight and the whole led light assembly came apart. When I put it back together, the light will not turn on at all with brand new batteries. Never buying cheap electronics like this from amazon since it is a hassle returning these items during the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great light to keep me safe on the road!
customer_reviews.text: Super bright, and I got two for the price of one when I ordered. Not a bad deal since i have two bikes. I like that I can take the headlight with me, which has been useful on more than one occasion. I've been using them for a couple of months now every morning and evening for my ride to/from work and haven't had to replace the batteries yet. LEDs are REALLY bright, so aim down if you don't want to blind drivers. If you plan to use these for night trail riding, I would get two and aim one right in front and one a little further out as the beam is pretty narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Front light great, rear light not
customer_reviews.text: I like the headlight, especially the strobe setting. It's bright. The rear light clip is slightly too small for the attachment and it can't attach securely. I lost the rear light over a bump after 10 miles and never found it. I bought a different rear light for a replacement that is actually way brighter anyway. I guess this still wasn't a bad deal for just the front light.
customer_reviews.author: thom's brain

customer_reviews.title: good headlight mounting design, but not the light itself
customer_reviews.text: The headlight is very convenient to mount on the bike so I bought two sets in 2018 within a couple of months. Everything is good at the beginning. However after changed the batteries a couple of times, one of the headlight got problem with the connection of the battery kit to the led light part. the metal part broken. Tonight I changed the battery for the second set and found the batteries leaked, cleaned and replaced with new batteries, the light was so weak. I was curious if the batteries are ok and changed to another set but the same really weak light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bicycle Light Set
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this set for quite a while now and havent had any issues with functionality. I like how bright both lights are especially when out riding at night or early morning. The battery life is great as I have only had to replace the batteries once since purchase. Overall, nice product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Safety that the kids love
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the kiddos birthday and he fell in love with it. Parenting win! Had multiple features, blinking, strobe, solid beam. People can definitely see him. Exactly the point! And with the multiple settings, it keeps him occupied and from getting board with it. Basically makes it fun to have it on!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: The quality of this product is excellent
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our son's birthday. Great product that requires 1 triple A battery. The front light is powerful and the rear does stand out with different warning light which makes it perfect. Compact and very easy installation. This does a good job so that my son can be seen. Works perfectly. The lights are removable for long lockups in public places. What would make it perfect if the lights were rechargeable. It also using a flashing mode to get attention of people and cars coming toward you. Great price for a great product. I would highly recommend it and would buy it again. 😊
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a basic bike light set
customer_reviews.text: Hard to argue with the value of this light set and for a price of $10 you can't go wrong. I considered this headlight more for others to see me than for me to see the road (beam is quite narrow focused.) Both the headlight and taillight have multiple modes (steady and flashing type) and are quite bright. One downside is the headlight requires 4-AAA batteries but it does throw-out a fair amount of light in return. As for quality of construction, you can tell it's not of the highest grade materials and finish but considering the price I think it is an overall great value.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Bright lights!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bike quite a bit and sometimes i find myself biking late at night. so often it seems that bikes are just riding around at night without any kind of lighting and its difficult to see them if you're driving. These two lights completely remedy that. The 5 LED light is blindingly bright and there is no way anyone is not going to notice you. The red light is also quite bright and great for a taillight. The lights all have thee settings: on, burst, and flashing. The burst will give you temporary blindness if you look directly at it, but the constant light is very nice. I feel much safer no when i'm biking at night thanks to these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smithe

customer_reviews.title: Really nice lights, easily portable
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Excellent brightness! Both of these lights can easily be taken off and used as personal protection light. A little tricky to get the headlight lens back on after battery install, but, I put it on a countertop to lineup the guides. That worked for me. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: zeemema

customer_reviews.title: Mice light
customer_reviews.text: Head light works great,, stop light I still have not found out how to turn it on. Other biker bought the same light system and no one can find out how to get the rear light to come on. So when you buy this you will only use the front light the rear will be for show only
customer_reviews.author: Bigg Silkk

customer_reviews.title: I ordered 2. The front light, in one ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2. The front light, in one of the packages , does not t turn off. I’ve read that in some of the other reviews too. So just make sure you check the functionality of the lights right away so that you can send back if needed. Other than that. It’s a bright light that should work well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: The only light you'll need.
customer_reviews.text: amazingly bright little lite. with straight beam/ slow and quick flash . Good quality & great value. PLUS they include a clip on red light with the same feature selection as the head light. I used it last nite and I can see the road clearly and oncoming vehicles can certainly see me. If you ride at nite..... get this lite
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Betcha

customer_reviews.title: Great, Although Require A Lot of Batteries
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the price. You need quite a few triple AAA batteries to get these up and going, though. Hoping they last a while on each round of batteries. The light is bright, though which is great. I also have a USB charged rear-light for my bike that wasn't much more expensive and resolves the battery issue and I prefer that one.
customer_reviews.author: Proper Bostonian

customer_reviews.title: Functional so far. The three modes of light emission were okay
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply manufactured, but functional. The connector for the taillight broke. The process of opening and closing the light fixtures to put in the batteries isn't very smooth. The headlight is especially spongy and hard to get properly lined up for a smooth close. Only time will tell how these items perform and hold up to frequent or repeated opening and closing. Not impressed, the picture is decieving, very small in size. The on-off button on the headlight is not too easy to use - It is flush with the body of the unit. It would be better if it protruded out for ease in changing light modes, solid, strobe, and intermittent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Silvestri

customer_reviews.title: Bright, solid
customer_reviews.text: The back light is a little dim and while the front (very bright) lasts a while, the 6 AAA batteries is a bit much. Front clip is also a little loose, but I've had no issues with the back as others have indicated. I got hit by a car and lost the front light. I just bought it again. So, that's an endorsement. Of the light, not the driver.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fogarty

customer_reviews.title: Tailight is a problem
customer_reviews.text: The headlight portion is great but the tailight is no good. The little rubbery rotary selector switch is very difficult to rotate and the battery polarity markings inside the unit are almost unreadable. The light output of the tail light is very dim so i bought another much better tail light. I g=figured it wasn't worth the bother to return the original and deal with warranty issues. New tail light from another manufacturer is great.
customer_reviews.author: Fitness guru

customer_reviews.title: The taillight is actually pretty bright for its size
customer_reviews.text: This is a cheap way of getting some safety on your bike. The taillight is actually pretty bright for its size, but the "chase" setting doesn't really make sense to have. The blink feature is nice, however. I haven't used the headlight yet, pending battery purchase, but it's a pretty simple little LED flashlight on a mount, so I'm hoping it'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kseniya Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great lights for night riding
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these lights to attach to my bike when riding at night. The installation was really easy and the lights are easy to take on and off when not in use. The lights are really bright and make it easy to see/be seen when riding at night.
customer_reviews.author: Jlrrx2206

customer_reviews.title: Surprising inexpensive light that works
customer_reviews.text: Lots of levels of lights to choose. This is an inexpensive light that is bright for the type of riding we do. Just at dusk in our residential neighborhood for short periods (maybe 1 hr). Works great and the rear light is very bright. Mounting is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Giralamo

customer_reviews.title: Will last you a month or two
customer_reviews.text: I've bought around five or six of this identical model over the past two years. Each one lasts between 2-4 months before it breaks in roughly the same place: the plastic piece which connects the detachable light with the ring which you fasten onto the handlebar. If your bike happens to fall over, it will break there. So I have a whole bunch of intact detachable lights in my junk drawer, and I pay like clockwork every couple of months for a new one to attach onto my bike. I ought to get a subscription for these...
customer_reviews.author: audiolipbalm

customer_reviews.title: I will buy another brand and see if it does better. Is there a warranty for this product
customer_reviews.text: We bought two sets in 2015, for bicycles in our home in FL which we don't use in the summer. This month, February, 2018 I noticed that neither the back light nor the rear light on one of our bikes were working. I checked batteries and they were okay, proving this by putting the batteries in the other set. Obviously a defective product. I will buy another brand and see if it does better. Is there a warranty for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Walter S Peckinpaugh Jr

customer_reviews.title: mounting system has a number of rubber rings that I am betting will wear out...but great otherwise
customer_reviews.text: this is very much brighter light than I have bought in the past but it is not rechargeable and uses 6 (which seems like overkill for LED lights?) total batteries. got it as a "deal" for $10 and that is a very good price in my estimation.
customer_reviews.author: Former Pilot

customer_reviews.title: headlight is a warning light, not for visibility
customer_reviews.text: headlight is a janky multi-prism led bogus light that's better for warning drivers and other people on the road you're approaching than it is for actually lighting up the road so you can see where you're riding. the tail light only has 3 modes; on, slow blink and left to right slow blink. this setup is as basic as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good intro set
customer_reviews.text: A good value for the money and they are water proof in rain. They are bright, easy to install and easy to remove from the provided holsters. Although that being said they are cheaply made, especially the taillight. I don't feel like they are going to last a really long time and I will likely upgrade them after some time as I ride my bike to work on average 50 miles over the course of a week. But if you are a casual rider and are gentle with your gear this is a great intro set.
customer_reviews.author: anonymouse

customer_reviews.title: As I normally end up riding at night a good headlight is important
customer_reviews.text: As I normally end up riding at night a good headlight is important. This light provides excellent bight light on the road ahead as well as some ambient light from the ring that slightly lights the surrounding area. The rear light is bright. Both front and back have multiple settings some great for night, others for dusk and day time. Batteries have lasted for some time not so definitely impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you paid for. The light does not shine uniformly, it is more of bunch of spots on the ground. Even though this one has more lumen than my other light, my other light looks brighter and shine better. The quality of the build is very inexpensive and this light requires 4 AAA batteries for the headlight and 2 AAA for the backlight.
customer_reviews.author: Tran

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Light Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a good light set for the cost. That being said, it is not the brightest or strongest. I bought it right after a got a new bike and used it until I could upgrade to stronger lights. I am still using the front light after getting a brighter rear light. The batteries last a long time. I also like that these are inexpensive because they are not a huge loss if stolen. I live in New York city, and sometimes I forget to remove my lights when I lock up my bike outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy with this purchase. I had difficulty opening both parts to add the batteries and once I did, I had difficulty putting them back together. Neither lit up. I switched out for different batteries and still did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Fiorentino

customer_reviews.title: I like how the lights are easily detached from the bike ...
customer_reviews.text: These lights are bright, VERY bright. Be sure you have the front lights aligned at the ground correctly when attached to a bike, or you might find an oncoming pedestrian complaining about them. I like how the lights are easily detached from the bike for other safety and travel uses, if desired.
customer_reviews.author: Sugarcube101

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you need.
customer_reviews.text: We ride around our neighborhood, which is very traffic-heavy, and has bike lanes that cars don't like to watch for. These lights have saved me at least 2-3 times during the day and night. Back and front lights are now required in our city for every bicycle, and the settings on these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome, with great price. Both front and rear lights works great. Different modes and front light is very adjustable to change the angle. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa Bicer

customer_reviews.title: this light would be pretty useless. As it is a well-lit street the ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter to use on a short (10 block) ride home late at night. If the street were not well lit, this light would be pretty useless. As it is a well-lit street the headlight works well enough. The taillight broke the 2nd time she used it. I just placed an order for a different tailight and we'll see but this one was incredibly disappointing. I bought at Target a 170 lumen head+tailight for myself that work amazingly well but for $20 more so I guess you get what you pay for (or maybe less). I'm really not happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good lights - frequently accidentally turn on in purse
customer_reviews.text: Lights are super bright and easy to attach. They are secure on the bike and come off easily when I want to remove them. They take six AAA batteries (four for the headlight; two for the tail), which are not included. The only trouble I've come across is that the tail light's on/off switch protrudes from the light on the back, and it has often turned itself on in my bag. Living in a city, leaving lights on my bike while it's locked up outside isn't an option (theives are everywhere!) so I take the lights off every time I park in a public place and put them in my bag, where the tail light frequently turns off.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: This was AWESOME! They are both super bright and very cheap
customer_reviews.text: This was AWESOME ! They are both super bright and very cheap. Best light for a bike I have ever had. Only downside is the plastic things on the back break easily especially if you ride ultra hard like I do. I ended up having to duct tape them on my bike. They are nice and bright and have the awesome option of making them strobe and blink which is really cool. EXTREMELY BRIGHT !!! GREAT FOR RIDING IN THE DARK !
customer_reviews.author: Oli

product_meta.title: BV Bicycle Light Set Super Bright 5 LED Headlight, 3 LED Taillight, Quick-Release
product_meta.description:
The LED light set mounts quickly onto bicycle handlebars and seat posts. Great for cycling at night or in places where visibility and safety are a concern. Visible to motorists over 1500 feet away. The headlight has 5 LEDs that can light up roads for over 40 feet and features a toolless handlebar mount. Once mounted it has a quick-release system for removing the headlight from its mount. Cut-away design allows light through the sides for more visibility. The taillight is angle adjustable and removable from its seat post mount with a clip-on quick-release system. Fits most handlebars and seat posts (rubber sizing shims included). Up to 80 hours! (Batteries not included). Note: Headlight batteries, body and cover must be aligned correctly in order to work. Align the power button on the battery holder with the power button on the headlight body. Align the arrow (on the clear plastic portion of the cover) with the open/close marks on the body)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The LED light set mounts quickly onto bicycle handlebars and seat posts. Great for cycling at night or in places where visibility and safety are a concern. Visible to motorists over 1500 feet away. The headlight has 5 LEDs that can light up roads for over 40 feet and features a toolless handlebar mount. Once mounted it has a quick-release system for removing the headlight from its mount. Cut-away design allows light through the sides for more visibility. The taillight is angle adjustable and removable from its seat post mount with a clip-on quick-release system. Fits most handlebars and seat posts (rubber sizing shims included). Up to 80 hours! (Batteries not included). Note: Headlight batteries, body and cover must be aligned correctly in order to work. Align the power button on the battery holder with the power button on the headlight body. Align the arrow (on the clear plastic portion of the cover) with the open/close marks on the body)
feature_bullets: 5 LED headlight, tool-less handlebar mount, 30-40 feet range, quick-release mount, 4.1
3 LED taillight, angle adjustable quick-release mount
Up to 80 hours, visible to motorists over 1500 feet away, 4 x AAA, 2 x AAA

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
